summary: A cyber incident early Monday morning has caused computer outages at the DuPage County Courthouse and sheriff’s office. The county has contacted the FBI and U.S. Secret Service. In-person court operations have been minimally impacted and are expected to continue as scheduled, officials say. There has been no impact on jail operations or on public safety, officials said. Chancery sales in the sheriff's office will be canceled this week, county officials say; all other county operations have not been impacted.

title: "No indications" that cyber attack caused blackout in Spain and Portugal, says EU
summary: Spain, Portugal and part of France suffered a widespread blackout on Monday. At around 12.30pm, power went out, causing widespread disruption to public transport, airports and many other services. Grid operator Red Electrica said that it was working to "gradually" restore power to the entire Spanish territory. Power has already been restored to zones in the north, south and west of the country it added. Meanwhile, Portugal's grid operator warned that problems could continue for another week. The blackout was not caused by any kind of attack, says Costa.

title: Paris Court Orders Total Liquidation of Cyber Group Studios - Animation Magazine
summary: The court has ordered the sale of all of the company’s assets. The sale includes all of its intellectual property. The company will be liquidated by the end of the year. The decision was made by the Court of Audience, not the court of Arbitration for the Review of Companies (CAFC), which has the power to order the sale. The CAFC has the right to sell the assets, but only if the sale is approved by the CAFC, which it has not done so yet.

title: Marks & Spencer hit by £800m blow as cyber attack leaves online orders frozen for fourth day
summary: Shares in M&S dropped by as much as 3.1 per cent in early trading on Monday, delivering a further £246 million hit to the company's market valuation. The retailer's stock price is now down by nearly 10 per cent since trading resumed after the Easter holidays last week. The ongoing disruption has left customers unable to place orders through the website and app since Friday. The company has ordered around 200 agency workers at its main distribution centre to stay at home as the disruption enters its second week.

title: Iran says it repelled 'the most widespread, complex' cyberattack
summary: Iran says it repelled 'the most widespread, complex' cyberattack. Iran has in the past accused its arch-foe Israel of being behind cyberattacks. Iran's biggest port of Bandar Abbas was rocked by a large explosion whose cause remains unknown. Israel's Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said on Sunday that Iran's nuclear infrastructure should be entirely dismantled - not just limited to prevent the development of nuclear weapons. The US and Iran concluded a third round of nuclear talks on Saturday in Oman.

title: Cyber outage affects DuPage courts, sheriff offices - Daily Herald
summary: Officials say the outage started around 2:30 a.m. on Monday. It affected the sheriff’s office, the 18th Judicial Circuit Court and the DuPage County Circuit Court Clerk's office. In-person court operations were “minimally impacted,’ according to a news release. The county reported the incident to the FBI and Secret Service, officials say. The sheriff's office and the courthouse are still affected as of 12:36 p.m., the county says.

title: Spain, Portugal, and parts of France and Belgium remain without power - Weather - Vreme
summary: Spain, Portugal, and parts of France and Belgium remain without power. It is still not known what caused the blackouts, which brought everything to a standstill. The head of the Spanish power grid announced that work is being done to eliminate the fault and that electricity has been restored in the south and north of the country. The President of the European Council, Antonio Costa, said that there are no indications that the interruption of electricity supply in the Iberian Peninsula was caused by a cyber attack.

title: Iran Repels Major Cyberattack Amid Rising Regional Tensions | Israel Defense
summary: Iran's Communications Minister Issa Zarepour confirmed the attempted breach, describing it as "one of the biggest cyberattacks" the country had encountered recently. No group has officially claimed responsibility, and Iranian officials have not publicly blamed any specific country. The cyber incident comes on the heels of a deadly explosion at the Shahid Rajaee port in southern Iran, which authorities said was likely caused by chemical materials igniting in storage facilities. The port had previously been targeted in a cyberattack widely attributed to Israeli forces, highlighting the strategic vulnerability of critical Iranian infrastructure.

title: Cybersecurity vendors are themselves under attack by hackers, SentinelOne says
summary: SentinelOne: Cybersecurity vendors are themselves under attack by hackers. Cybersecurity companies don’t just defend their customers against cyberattacks — they also have to defend themselves. A SentinelOne report published Monday examines some of the biggest threats they’re facing. Those include ransomware, Chinese government-sponsored hackers and North Korean IT workers posing as job applicants, according to the report from SentinelOne’s SentinelLabs.“Talking about being targeted is uncomfortable for any organization. For cybersecurity vendors, it's practically taboo,” the report states.

title: Top Tier Target | What It Takes to Defend a Cybersecurity Company from Today's Adversaries
summary: SentinelOne has observed and defended against a spectrum of attacks ranging from financially motivated crimeware to tailored campaigns by advanced nation-state actors. Adversaries included DPRK IT workers posing as job applicants, ransomware operators probing for ways to access/abuse our platform, and Chinese state-sponsored actors targeting organizations aligned with our business and customer base. This report highlights a rarely-discussed but crucially important attack surface: security vendors themselves. When adversaries compromise a security company, they don’t just breach a single environment—they potentially gain insight into how thousands of environments and millions of endpoints are protected.

title: Spain, Portugal work to fix massive power outage - Bundle
summary: Spain's Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez said the aim was to have restored power nationwide "soon" The cause of the outage was still to be determined, the prime minister stressed. He called on his country to show "responsibility and civility" to help authorities manage a sweeping power outage.. Spain, Portugal work to fix massive power outage - Bundle.

title: Cyber incident still impacting sales at M&S, agency workers told to stay home
summary: Cyber incident still impacting sales at M&S, agency workers told to stay home. title: European power grid problem caused Iberian outage, says Spanish Prime Minister

The outage hit across Spain and Portugal, including their capitals, Madrid and Lisbon. Offices closed and traffic was gridlocked as traffic lights stopped working. It was not possible to make calls on some mobile phone networks. Spanish airports were operating on backup electrical systems and some flights were delayed.

title: Google warns Gmail users of sophisticated government-backed cyber attacks

Certain users have been specifically marked as potential targets by state-linked hacking groups. These attacks often aim at journalists, activists, researchers, policy makers, and individuals linked to high-profile organizations.

title: Authorities report more than 40 personal data leak incidents in Kazakhstan this year
summary: Authorities report more than 40 personal data leak incidents in Kazakhstan this year. Officials admit that the number of leaks is continually growing. The Digital Ministry announced plans to create a register of personal data lost by Kazakhstani citizens, allowing individuals to check whether their information has been compromised. The agency also intends to introduce a mechanism for cyber insurance against such data leaks. The number of data leaks in Kazakhstan is rising due to the country’s overall digitalization.

title: US conducts cyberattacks against major Chinese commercial encryption provider: report
summary: US conducts cyberattacks against major Chinese commercial encryption provider: report. Experts warned that commercial encryption systems underpin everyday activities such as financial transactions. They told the Global Times on Monday that attacks on Chinese encryption products could severely compromise national cybersecurity. The report detailed that throughout 2024, US intelligence agencies exploited a vulnerability in a customer relationship management (CRM) system used by the Chinese company. The compromised system contained over 600 user accounts, 8,000 customer profile records, and more than 10,000 contract orders.

title: Cyber experts urge Trump to abandon Chris Krebs investigation | Cybersecurity Dive

title: Federal authorities probing ongoing cyber incident at city of Abilene
summary: The city of Abilene is experiencing a cyber attack. The city filed a catastrophe notice to suspend requirements to provide public information. title: Everything we know about the M&S cyber attack that halted online orders

title: NVIDIA Riva Vulnerabilities Leave AI-Powered Speech and Translation Services at Risk
summary: NVIDIA Riva Vulnerabilities Leave AI-Powered Speech and Translation Services at Risk. title: 'Source of data': are electric cars vulnerable to cyber spies and hackers? - The Guardian
summary: Electric cars have myriad ways of generating data that is of interest to hostile states. wifi or cellular connectivity could allow data to be exfiltrated. title: Kaspersky calls for cyber immunity amid growing cyber threats | Computer Weekly
summary: Kaspersky CEO Eugene Kaspersky spoke at Gitex Asia 2025 in Singapore. He highlighted the growing sophistication of cyber crime syndicates and state-sponsored actors. title: CISA Adds Three Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog
summary: CISA has added three new vulnerabilities to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities Catalog, based on evidence of active exploitation. BOD 22-01 requires Federal Civilian Executive Branch (FCEB) agencies to remediate identified vulnerabilities by the due date to protect FCEB networks against active threats. CISA strongly urges all organizations to reduce their exposure to cyberattacks by prioritizing timely remediation of Catalog vulnerabilities.

title: Zero-day exploitation drops slightly from last year, Google report finds | Cybersecurity Dive
summary: Google said it saw hackers exploit fewer zero-day vulnerabilities in the wild in 2024 than in 2023. The company attributed the decrease to improvements in secure software development practices. Still, Google said it is seeing a “slow but steady” increase in the rate ofzero-day exploitation over time. For the first time, Google found as many incidents of North Korea exploiting zero-days as it did incidents of China doing so.. title: Most Kazakhstani entities can't meet data rules, says cyber expert

title: Cybersecurity experts issue response to Trump order targeting Chris Krebs, SentinelOne

title: Marks & Spencer breach linked to Scattered Spider ransomware attack - Bleeping Computer

Today, Sky News reported that the disruption continues, with around 200 warehouse workers told to stay home as the company responds to the attack. The investigation so far indicates that the hacking collective known as ScatteredSpider, or as Microsoft calls them, Octo Tempest, is behind the attack, BleepingComputer has learned.

title: Hitachi Vantara takes servers offline after Akira ransomware attack - Bleeping Computer

Depending on the privileges associated with the user an attacker. could then install programs; view, change, or delete data; or create new. accounts with full user rights.

title: 'Rogue' devices found in Chinese solar inverters raises cybersecurity alarm in Europe
summary: 'Rogue' devices found in Chinese solar inverters raises cybersecurity alarm in Europe. Similar devices were also found inChinese-made batteries. Inverters are highly digitalised products, often referred to as the “heart” or “brain” of a PV system. In theory, hackers could remotely disrupt or switch off solar power supply if they could control the inverter. The European Solar Manufacturing Council (ESMC) said that: “With over 200GW of Europe’s solar capacity relying on these inverters—equivalent to more than 200 nuclear power plants—the security risk is systemic”

title: Report: Transit industry unprepared for more cybersecurity threats - Progressive Railroading
summary: The transit industry is unprepared for increased cybersecurity threats and attacks, according to a new report. The report was released by the Mineta Transportation Institution (MTI), a research center at San Jose State University. MTI first released a report in 2020 that found the industry was not prepared for cyberthreats and attacks and recommended policy changes. The updated report released yesterday shows no significant improvement in preparedness, the authors of the latest report said. The increasing sophistication of cybercriminals, in combination with a greater reliance on technology within the transit industry, puts the industry at higher risk than in 2020, they said.

title: Report: Cyber threats outpace global readiness - SC Media
summary: The World Economic Forum reports that cybersecurity threats are intensifying amid rising geopolitical tensions, AI-powered attacks, and increasingly complex tactics from threat actors like Salt Typhoon and Lazarus. Experts warn that governments must shift from reactive policymaking toward adaptive, accountable strategies that treat cybersecurity as a trust-building and innovation-enabling business asset. title: New leadership picks for Cyber Command, NSA coming soon amid broader decision on structure
summary: New leadership picks for Cyber Command, NSA coming soon amid broader decision on structure. President Donald Trump surprised many last month when he ordered Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth to fire Gen. Now, the administration could name Noble's replacement in the coming days, or at least before the Memorial Day holiday.

summary: Google is rolling out new security features for Android devices as part of its latest operating system update, Android 16. title: SAP patches second zero-day flaw exploited in recent attacks - Bleeping Computer
summary: SAP has released patches to address a second vulnerability exploited in recent attacks targeting SAP NetWeaver servers as a zero-day. The company issued security updates for this security flaw (CVE-2025-42999) on Monday, May 12. The flaw was discovered while investigating zero- day attacks involving another unauthenticated file upload flaw (tracked as CVE-20 25-31324) that was fixed in April. The Shadowserver Foundation is now tracking over 204 SAP Netweaver servers exposed on the Internet.
